DataElement.preferredName: Transrectal Ultrasound Thick Midline Echo Prostate Area Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a value measuring a two-dimensional region of the prostate gland where echoes reflect poorly due to tissue density during an imaging technique where sound waves create an image of the gland.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transrectal Ultrasound Thick Midline Echo Prostate Area
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the region of the prostate gland where echoes reflect poorly due to tissue density during a diagnostic imaging technique where sound waves create an image of the gland using a rectal probe.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the prostate gland. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter the prostate. Prostate tumors sometimes create echoes that are different from normal prostate tissue. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the prostate.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination.  This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.

Property.preferredName: ULTRASOUND THICK MIDLINE ECHO Prostate Area
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS):Area; the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
Area; the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a value measuring a calculated two-dimensional size or area for an organ in the human body (a portion or whole) as determined by surgical or pathological measure or by a diagnostic imaging procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Area is the the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

DataElement.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
